app.name: AIOS Core
app.one_liner: An AI-Orchestrated System for Full Stack Development powered by self-modifying, agent-driven agile development.

screens.name: Agent Activation & Command Interface
screens.purpose: Enable users to activate AI agents and issue initial commands via their chosen IDE or CLI.
primary_actions: Activate agent via IDE-specific trigger (e.g., /agent-name in Claude)
Confirm successful greeting and useful output

rust_commands.name: aios_init
rust_commands.purpose: Initialize a new AIOS project in a specified directory.

rust_commands.name: aios_install
rust_commands.purpose: Install AIOS into an existing project.

rust_commands.name: aios_update
rust_commands.purpose: Update the AIOS framework to the latest version.

mvp_plan: week 1: Define agent activation protocol across supported IDEs
week 1: Document IDE-specific integration paths and limitations
week 1: Implement core CLI commands: init, install, update
acceptance_tests: The `aios-core update` command correctly resolves and installs the latest published version without attempting to install `@synkra/aios-core@null`.
User can run `npx aios-core init my-project` and successfully create a new project with valid agent files compatible with GitHub Copilot/CLI Custom Agents format.
User can run `npx aios-core install` in an existing project and activate an agent in Claude Code using `/agent-name`, receiving a valid greeting and useful response to `*help` within 10 minutes.
YAML agent definition files (e.g., oalanicolas.md) parse correctly without syntax errors during squad creation.
